text: UPDATE: APRIL 7, 2016 ----THIS LOCATION HAS CLOSED---- Season's 52, located at 55 E. Grand Avenue, has closed - a sign in the door last night (April 7) asks guests to dine across the street at their sister restaurant , Eddie V's.
This location is closed as of Monday April 4th. It is no longer open for business at his location.

We went for Easter dinner.  I think,portion size was an issue since most people are used to these giant portions.  I reminded everyone that all meals are under 500'calorirs so your  diets are safe lol I love those little mini desserts

We came in on Thursday around 5pm and to our surprise they have a discounted bar menu from 5-7pm (i think).  They have 8 appetizers for $5 each.  Well, we got all 8!  I couldn't recommend them enough!  The scallops & shrimp were delish, the meatballs - soooo goood, the lamp chops & duck are excellent and the tuna was gone in 5 seconds (thanks dad!).  I also got the wine flight with 3 samplings and a full pour of your favorite for $15 plus a flatbread.  We got the lobster for $5 extra.  It was really awesome. My mom is lactose intolerant.  Our server Xio couldn't of been more helpful about it.  Every appetizer was made without dairy and the dairy toppings were served on the side for my dad & I to use. We also got the Sea Bass & Filet for our entrees (we were hungry...lol).  Both were on the lactose free menu and soooooooooo freaking good. We are DEFINITELY coming back over and over again.

Seasons 52 five star plus!!! Decided to pop into Seasons 52 after work on Friday to check out their menu. The hostess was very friendly sat me near the bar area, as I was looking over the menus a server had offered me water and said someone would be back shortly. Almost 30 mins still no one had even come back to table to see if I was ready to order or if I wanted a drink. After speaking to the hostess again and the manager the customer service was awesome! I wish Yelp had more options other than just a five start over all review. The customer service and manger were a 10 plus for the night. The waitress that took my order was also a delight. She recommended a great wine selection and dishes off the menu. Started out with a crisp glass of Care Bread 13, Chardonnay paired with pipping hot Lump Crab, Roasted Shrimp & Spinach Stuffed Mushrooms under a Parmesan-panko crust. To DIE for! They were absolutely delish plus small enough where you weren't to full for dinner. Moving on to the main dish, another amazing glass of wine that complemented my fish selection perfect. Went with Spy Valley 14, Savignac Blanc paired with the chef selection that was recommend Asian -Glazed  Chilean Sea Bass Entrée over a organic black rice, snow peas, shiitake mushrooms, micro wasabi. One of the best pieces of Sea Bass I've had. The glaze was perfect, the fish was cooked to perfection. Light and slightly crisp on top. Delicious from beginning to end. Was way to full for dessert so I'll have to make it a point to go back!!  Service 10+  Food 10+

Chic, nice appetizers, fair selection of wines in the heart of chicago. I really liked this place. I received a promo from this place through amex an year ago, and my first thought was "too expensive". I was wrong, they have reasonable prices and the food is great. I'd totally come back.

I absolutely love this place!! Went last night for the first time to celebrate a friends birthday.  We ordered from the happy hour menu and we were not disappointed.  The ambience is very nice and it was nice to be able to hear the people that I was with.  The booth was nice a roomy and I just love the look of this place.  I had the shrimp scampi skillet, lollipop lamb chops, and a Hawaiian pineapple cosmo.  Everything was perfect!!  The shrimp were juicy and succulent and not dried out like a lot of places do and my absolute favorite was the lamb chops.  I ordered mine medium well and it was juicy and very tasty with the balsamic glaze.  I look forward to coming back to enjoy more things from the menu.  I highly recommend this place.

Brought my wife here for her birthday weekend during lunch. The staff was very accommodating, our waitress brought us champagne after we settled in. When it was time for dessert, the waitress brought a candle along with a nice display of a tiered dessert stand of mini dessert shooters. Good food, great service

We came in for lunch and loved our food and waitress! I ordered the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and broccolini...yum. Cooked to perfection! Hubby had the Chilean sea bass with black rice. He also loved how the chef prepared the fish.  We ordered a side of Brussels sprouts that were on the lunch special: so good, crunchy bits of bacon and perfectly seasoned. Since it was my birthday weekend hubby mentioned it to the staff when he made reservations and we both got a glass of champagne! Wait staff was so sweet and attentive to us! We got some complimentary dessert shooters that were bomb! I had the cannoli raspberry one and hubby had the chocolate ganache one. Great cozy place! Will be back!
I was looking for something new and this was the place. Great service and excellent food. If you enjoy sea bass I definitely recommend it.

Went for lunch and was pleased with the range of dishes and prices on the menu.  Appetizers were generous enough to share.   I had flatbread and my companion had fish.  Both were very tasty.  Jeff, our server, was very attentive.  The room is decorated in California Modern and has a nice vibe to it.

This is my first Yelp review ever as I am not so pleased with most of the restaurants due to their limited options for vegetarian food. Being strict vegetarian it is always difficult to find restaurants who has variety and something new to offer. This place was surprisingly delightful and so much vegetarian friendly. It was one of your friend's birthday and we took him out for dinner and it was best place we could have thought of. Server Adrene was so friendly and helpful.  Loved the ambiance. We really enjoyed the dinner today and it is has become of my favorite restaurants for special occasions. Regards, PM

I typically don't review chain restaurants as I feel like Yelp really benefits the smaller businesses, but I just love this restaurant so much I felt I`d make an exception. Came to this location for the first time on a Wednesday night for an early dinner (6:15) and the place was pretty empty. Guess I didn't need to make a reservation. My friend & I decided to split a bunch of things because we couldn't decide- everything looked so good: Ambiance- Great! Large booths, dimly lit room but not too dim. Easy to have a conversation with your tablemates. Also our waiter was really friendly and didn't rush us as we were catching up and took awhile to order each course, but was always available when we were ready to order. Artichoke & Goat Cheese Flatbread- Delicious! Flavors worked very well together, the cheese wasn't too heavy and the crust was very very light Stuffed Mushrooms (seasonal) - So good! Very heavy spinach flavor for the stuffing but if you like Spinach, then this is your dish. Comes with 3, so not the easiest to split with 2 as it was messy to cut in half. Asian Glazed Grilled Chicken Skewers- Great! Also comes with 3 but easier to split as we just cut the 3rd skewer in half. Chilean Sea Bass- Comparable to the Sea Bass I got from Joe`s. Fantastic! Came on a bed of black rice which neither of us had ever had which was quite good, and some snow peas. Only recommendation would be more snowpeas. I love this place. So happy there's been one in every city I've lived in thusfar :) I`ll definitely be back to this location!

I had visited this restaurant today with my coworkers and supervisor who had treated us to lunch. The restaurant is beautiful. Everyone who worked inside of the restaurant was very friendly. Our waitress was kind, patient, and efficient. My coworkers and I did not have to wait a very long time for our lunch.We had ordered from the "Restaurant Week" menu which included a three course meal for $22. I had selected the Mediterranean Vegetable Soup, Roasted Half Chicken w/ Mashed Potatoes and side vegetables, and Dessert.The entire meal was delicious. Our food was served fresh and the portion size was excellent. My coworkers and I had also ordered a Raspberry Lemonade which was made with sparkling water. We did not enjoy the Raspberry Lemonade. However, the bartender was very accommodating when we had asked to switch our drinks to the regular Lemonade. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys dining in an intimate setting with great food and nice customer service. I plan to return here soon!!!

Went during restaurant week.  Outstanding food and service.  Flatbreads were a real highlight and have great variety.  Our entrees- cedar plank salmon, roasted chicken, and shrimp and grits were tasty and properly apportioned.  Meal ended with 2 samples of various desserts served in shot glasses.  Our table tried the raspberry canoli, carrot cake, pecan pie, chocolate mousse and key lime pie.  They were all delicious.  It was a great deal too, 4 courses- flatbread appetizer, salad, entree and dessert for $33.  Highly recommended!

Nice place, disappointing food.  I chose what's called the "half chicken" on the menu, but is actually a "quarter chicken." Unless they've created a variety of bird without thighs or wings. So 2 pieces of chicken, and a few chunks of barely cooked vegetables.  I make roasted veggies at home all the time. They're delicious.  These were hard and flavorless. The plate basically just tasted of salt.  I am not on a low-salt diet.  I eat plenty of salt.  And this was overwhelming.  The desserts were bad too!  Dessert is almost impossible to mess up, in my opinion. I have a huge sweet tooth.  The key lime selection was (again!) salty. We also sampled a chocolate-raspberry concoction but only took one bite each.  I didn't let on how bad it all was because I didn't want my date to know I didn't like it.  But I wouldn't go back.  Seriously, Seasons, it's a 1/4 chicken.  Either change the menu or add the missing pieces.  And take that salt shaker away from the chef.  Yuck.

Had to make a stop in Chicago with my husband and children on Thanksgiving. Great service and food. The bartender made us great "Old Fashions". Can't wait to visit Chicago again and eat at Seasons 52.

I chose this place because it had open reservations on Open Table. Also, I knew there would be a few vegetarian dishes. My friends and I went here around 8:15 PM. We sat down and immediately got that week's menu. Get it? Seasons 52?  I chose butternut squash, organic field greens and flat bread. All of them were good but none of the dish stood out to me. I was just happy my friends had choices to choose from. Since it was my birthday, I got a free dessert. There was a try f shot glasses and each glass had a different dessert. The blueberry lemon curd was really good but a little too sweet for my taste. I think the waitress was outstanding though. She didn't just ask how we were doing; she actually stood there for a second to have a brief conversation. I think she really deserves the credit or making this a good experience.
The flatbread was very good..had the lobster flatbread. Butternut squash soup was very flavorful. We enjoyed a filet and scallops. Service was good as well.

My husband and I were visiting from FL and searching for a place for a light dinner.  Found out about Seasons happy hour menu ($5 apps and discounted drinks!) The app choices were great for the price...our favorites, the shrimp skillet and seared tuna.  We then split the lobster flat bread which was very light but flavorful.  Very happy with all the food.  The waiter told us they have locations in FL, so we are looking forward to visiting Seasons back home:)
In Chicago for RSNA. Good food and drinks, with adequate service. A bit more attention to detail on the part of the server would have been nice.

First time here. Food options were good, more focused on selection quality than quantity. Flatbreads were light and tasty appetizers. Main course meals such as salmon, scallops, and pork were nice presentations and fresh. Salad served in a tube then dropped was interesting and notably fresh. Specialty drinks and wine menu were above average. Location downtown --factor in additional costs for parking.

This is one of my favorite chains across the country. Their seasonal menu makes it exciting to visit, but their staples also are a comfort. Upon this last visit, I shared one of their flatbread pizzas with a business associate and we're both very satisfied. Our entrees were prepared perfectly and out server was friendly and knowledgable. Check to see if there's one in your area and make a reservation. Oh, and leave room for their dessert shooters. You will not be disappointed.

We love this place! It is a relaxing respite from shopping and crowds on Michigan Ave. We were going to have lunch at Eatily and ran from that place: loud and crowded. The food here is fantastic. I had the porcini bisque and the Korean duck lettuce wraps. My husband had the rainbow trout dinner. Everything was fabulous!

I had never heard of this place, but came with a friend.  We sat at the bar and indulged in some wine flights and flatbread first.  Both were fabulous.  Then we moved to a table and had dinner. The bartender and server were both friendly and informative providing lots of information about the menu items.  I always have problems deciding what to order so boy was it hard when I knew everything on the menu was fresh and it all sounded, and looked, so good.   Yep, I'm the lookie-loo who stares down your food as I'm being seated, or as it's being served to you.  And if I don't walk past enough tables with food on the way to my seat I have no shame in going the "long way" to the restroom so I can ogle more items. Anyhow, I ordered a tuna salad and it was devine. I will definitely return here.  Yummy, yum! And the live piano music was a fabulous addition to our evening.  I made sure to go out of my way to tip the player and compliment her. What a lovely place.

Tried pretty much everything on their happy hour menu and wasn't disappointed. The happy hour app portions are fairly small, but at that price point (I think they were $5), I felt like we were getting our money's worth. The happy hour special wines weren't anything to write home about, but they have enough wines on their non-happy hour list that you're sure to find something you like. I also went for dinner with a friend and they forgot to remove the nuts from one of their dishes (she had asked ahead of time -- not a dangerous allergy, but her mouth gets itchy, which she understandably wants to avoid...). The waiter apologized as soon as he recognized the error and the dish was promptly replaced, no harm, no foul.
Great drinks and good selections of food . We love this place . One of our favorite restaurant in Chicago . Try their bruschetta. Yum yum

Not sure where everyone else is eating, but I gotta say this place is a rip-off.  Don't waist your money. Portions in comparison to price not good. My son had a New York "steak" for $31.00!! Seriously,  Sizzler had a better piece of meat. My brother ordered the Lobster specialty. Returned.  My rack of lamb while decent wasn't worth the price. My wife had scallops which were delicious. Bottom line save your money don't come here!!!

Had a great meal here with my brother and mother. Nice ambience, quiet! Incredible pumpkin pisco cocktail. Would would go back just for that. Paul, our waiter, was a kick. Friendly, very knowledgeable about the menu, including the wine list. He didn't steer us wrong with anything. Food was great. Fresh, clean. Very accommodating to my myriad of "substitutes". Would definitely go back when I'm in town again.

Our waitress was very pushy to have us order the flat bread. Once we ordered it, was just mediocre. The restaurant was nicely decorated, however the group we sat behind was very loud, obscene with their language which made the experience worse. I ordered the rack of lamb. The meat was very rare and nearly inedible, the potatoes were cold. The reviews we read indicated it was from the farm to the table, but I did not feel that way.

Dear seasons 52.  I have to break up with you again.  Your $52 coupon and nice note from the "new" chef lured me back but, alas, so disappointing.  I can't bring myself to list in detail the service and dining infractions,  cold food that should be hot, warm food that should be cold, servers actually placing used plates on our bar table as we waited for a dining table,  being summoned to the host stand for our table only to wait while they checked on the table.  3 ladies gathered around the host stand discussing ailments who suggested we just eat at the bar.  Let me remind you this is the table used to stage dirty dishes. Food mediocre and did not come close to offsetting the other flaws. So that's it S52, fool me once shame on me -fool me twice ....

Great service for a restaurant downtown in the thick of tourist attractions and shopping. However, they're menu definitely includes items that can be calorie-heavy, though I'm glad they at least provide all of that information. Portions are very generous, though I didn't leave stuffed, which is good. I had scallops and asparagus, both of which were very tasty. The hummus appetizer is nice as well.
Went here for dinner and it was fantastic.  The prices were reasonable, the service was great and the food was outstanding.  I don't know why I waited so long to come here.

Last night the four of us went to Seasons 52 River North for dinner around 7:30 because the reviews looked decent. The prices showed around $30 so we felt casual was fine. The Restaurant was only half full but the waitress showed no interest in our table. It took ten minutes just to get drinks we ordered. Then I ordered a bottle of wine not the most expensive but drinkable and the waitress immediately corrected my pronunciation of the brand which was Mirassou. First of all don't correct the customer. Second of all be right if you are correcting someone. My pronunciation was Mira-sue ( correct )Hers was Mira-Sao ( incorrect ). Check it out lady and remember the customer is always right. We were on vacation here from Oregon for the week and have enjoyed much of the cuisine that Chicago has to offer. There is so much to choose from but this was one choice we wished we didn't make because of the service. The food was good but the neglect in service made the experience one to forget.

Brought the hubby here for his birthday.   It was a Thursday night and very busy. There was a 45mind wait. But we were lucky to get a seat at the bar. The service was great! The food was good but not the best. We both ordered a sea food dish. The food is a bit pricy. Great wine and drink menu.   *I recommend to RSVP for fast seating

Live about a mile from restaurants and never heard of...usually avoid this tourist locale. Food was terrific, had a beautifully prepared branzino. Terrific wine selects at fair prices. Nice staff...decor fine. Will definitely return.
Wonderful Sesame Grilled Salmon. Highly recommend! Great service! We'll be back!
Great dinner option if you want to be on the healthy side. Seasonal menu with fresh ingredients. Great wine list. One of our top choices for date night.

I came here for a Yelp Elite event where we were given the opportunity to sample the fall menu.  Flatbreads are featured heavy on their menu, but there are no complaints from this girl. Each flatbread was just as delicious as the one before it - my favorite was the one with arugula! The wonderful part of the flatbreads was that they each had a wine pairing that was perfect. In terms of food, the other exciting features to the menu are the butternut squash ravioli with sweet potatoes and the glazed chicken skewers. Those ravioli were so delicious and the chicken was so perfectly cooked that it just easily came apart when you went to go in for a bite (I hate it when the food on skewers is overcooked and tough). Although I love good food my favorite parts of the event were the two cocktails featured. The pair cocktail was delicious! If you go you must try it! Not too sweet at all.  But the real knockout was the Pisco Sour. Pisco is an amber colored brandy made in the winemaking regions of Peru and Chile. The sour part comes from the citrus juices. I loved this drink because it brought back memories of sitting on the patio of a fancy restaurant in the Miraflores district of Lima, Peru, sipping on my first Pisco Sour, just a day after I had landed. The drink is amazing and it seemed pretty authentic - although it wasn't as strong as any cocktail I had in Peru.  Overall, this was a wonderful opportunity and the food and company were wonderful! I definitely want to come back for the Pisco Sour and those flatbreads!

3 stars for the food. 5 stars for the staff.  My friend and I attended the Yelp Elite event. Maybe it's because we're young, but I can't imagine paying that much for the food. It's good, don't get me wrong. But it's not great (the wine was, though!). The staff on the other hand is fabulous!

I came here for dinner with my husband and we had a lovely evening. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. However, i wish the portions were slightly bigger. I felt hungry an hour or so after dinner.

Came for a Yelp event and had a pretty good experience. I found the flatbreads generally a little uneven, so you really need to love the flavors involved (i.e., if you adore mushrooms and basically want a mushroom delivery vehicle, get the triple mushroom one). The only truly balanced one I had was the pesto chicken flatbread, which had plenty of different flavors. The squash ravioli was to do die for - definitely consider it. Good variety of wine available. Every staff member I interacted with was very nice and funny, which bumped a 3.5 star experience up to 4.

We were here for an event and loved the food being served. The fall menu is phenomenal! Servers are wonderful (especially Nick!) We stayed for dessert at the bar after our event. Bartender was super nice and helpful with the dessert selections. There were eight lovely little cups of deliciousness to choose from. I selected two, my date selected another two. Perfect! My favorite was the key lime pie. The nutty bar (I think that's what it was called was my second favorite) had brownie and lots of peanuts on top. In any case, this restaurant has a wonderful selection of wines (lovely reds from Italy) and fresh flavored goodness. All their menu items are prepared with what is fresh in season, hence the name Seasons 52. Check them out. The butternut squash ravioli is like butter. MUST HAVE! Can't wait to come back for dinner. This is totally great place for a date or just to chill with some great cocktails and appetizers, or a full blown dinner. Please try them out. I can't wait to come back.

I attended the yelp elite event here on 08/31/15. It was scheduled from 6-8, so I was able to conveniently make there in a timely fashion from work. Seasons 52 granted us a gracious welcome and we were shown to our meeting area by a pleasant young lady. Once there, there were several different tables set up with food and wine pairings, accompanied with a knowledgable server. All of the food was very good and tasty and the wines were just as flavorful. My favorite dish had to be the butternut squash and ravioli. This was my very first yelp elite event and I think it went very well. I plan to attend more events such as this in the future.

Attended the Yelp Elite event on 8/31/2015 and am now reviewing what I consumed with the website-posted menu prices in mind. We were primarily treated to items from the "Flights and Flatbreads" menu and a choice morsel from the Happy Hour menu, otherwise known as "Sunset at Seasons 52."  Off the HH menu, we swarmed the Grilled Chicken Yakitori Skewers - they were juicy for white meat and glazed with a sweet soy reduction. We might have also gotten the HH lamb chops but they didn't taste like lamb nor was there evident "Kona" crusting? They looked like lamb chops but tasted like pork and I haven't been able to find a likelier item on the menu. Anyways, these mystery chops were also delicious and juicy despite being enigmatic.  Off the wine flight selections, I enjoyed the Montevina Pinot Grigio the most. The riesling offered was on the sweet side but well-balanced. Their reds were more alcohol-forward but soft mouthfeel. Their flatbreads were of the thin crisp variety rather than the chewy bread kind but generously decked with toppings. Favorites were: Roasted Roma Tomato, Blackened Steak and Blue Cheese, and the Trio of Roasted Mushrooms flatbread.  Off the Autumn Dinner menu, the Porcini Mushroom Bisque didn't look attractive but was very good. The Caramelized Brussel Sprouts were much more exciting than the Roasted Acorn Squash. Finally, Kabocha Squash Ravioli were al dente on the outside but filled with scalding hot nutty orange sweet goodness. Eat with caution but gusto.  Staff was uniformly friendly and competent despite being surrounded by excitable Yelpers!

Came here for a yelp elite event and what a good experience. The event itself was that we would get a tasting of the fall menu. So we started out with sampling all sorts of flatbreads that I can't remember the names of because they were so good. I do know that there was a mushroom one and a steak with blue cheese flatbread that I couldn't stop eating. The mushroom soup was also delicious: lots of flavor and not too filling. There was then some grilled butternut squash and some other vegetables: pretty well done. I will say that the entrees or what I would assume would be entrees on the actual menu were soo good. The chicken skewer had a good glaze that didn't overpower the actual taste of the chicken. The lamb chop was so tender; I don't think I've had a better one. The ravioli with squash and walnuts was such an interesting but well thought out mix of flavors. There were also tastings of wine and cocktails but since I'm not much of a drinker I didn't really try any but the yelpers I met enjoyed them. I must say that the service here is great. The staff took the time to explain what everything was and they were super nice. Definitely want to come back for the full restaurant experience!

Had a wonderful experience here and would definitely come back again! We tried the new fall menu, which includes: three mushroom soup, pesto chicken flatbread, lobster flatbread, steak flatbread, mushroom flatbread, tomato pesto flatbread, artichoke flatbread, cheese and squash ravioli, teriyaki chicken screwers, seasoned squash, brussels sprouts and lamb chops. Each of the dishes came with an accompanying wine, which were complimentary together.  The food was unbelievably delicious. Compliments to the chef! Everyone was seasoned beautiful and the fall presence was felt through each bite. My favorite was the lobster flatbread and chicken screwers. The mushroom soup was very good, and tasted great. The rest of the flatbreads were nice as well. The lamb chops were cooked to perfection (medium well) with a slight grilled char on the outside, I would say it was a bit salty but besides that excellent nonetheless.  The interior is beautiful. An elegant and upscale dining experience. One of the best steakhouses in Chicago by far.  The waiting staff and manager were excellent. The service was fast, friendly and efficient.  We had a great time and highly recommended to anyone to come check out the new fall menu! It's delicious and well worth it.

Healthy options for the portion conscience eater. I went for an event that previewed the new fall menu. There were many options of flatbread that satisfy any flavor craving you have. The lobster flatbread melted in your mouth. They come out on wood planks to help keep them warm on the table. The other crowd favorite was the butternut squash ravioli. They were so creamy and well paired with seasoned sweet potatoes. The staff was so knowledgeable, even about the yet to be released fall menu. They were extremely helpful and kind. The gm and manager were in the backroom for our private event and were pitching in making sure everyone was happy. I can safely say that everyone was smiling and delightfully full.
Reasonably priced and great variety for vegetarians! Desert was perfect, small and tasty.

Came here after our reservation at Eddie V's got canceled due to them closing down for the night because their sewage was backed off. It was a Saturday night so we were pretty much screwed as far as getting a last minute reservation at a nice place. So because of convenience we came here.  Our waitress not only looked like she was 12 but also acted like she was 12.  Her service was horrendous. We never even got water. Food was mediocre at best. There are way too many good restaurants in this city....don't waste your time and money here.

One of the best Steak Houses in Chicago! I came here expecting to eat a soft and well done Filet Mignon and I did!! I first ordered the grilled garlic pesto chicken flatbread and it was delicious and with lots of flavor. The drinks I ordered were amazing. The service was excellent!

Quiet as a church and just as dark. Most of the seating is in high back, padded banquettes that are very comfortable for a party of two and make for a very hushed atmosphere. The staff is attentive. My dining partner and I split two flatbreads which provided some variation.  The flatbread is enough for a light lunch but to eat the whole thing is a bit boring.  The artichoke and goat cheese flatbread was very flavorful; the seasonal flatbread with bacon, fig and arugula had no shortage of greens but the bacon flavor just didn't come through and there was little visual evidence of bacon.   Lunch prices are reasonable for the River North neighborhood but I think that there are more interesting menus at this price point in the neighborhood.  The desserts weren't offered to us (did we look like we were in a hurry or not interested?) but are attractively presented on a tray to entice diners who want an indulgence of 400 calories or less.  By the way, I do like the fact that calories are shown on the menu.

The soups here are fantastic. We had the corn and the tomato soups and they were each just totally delicious. The flatbread and the pork in lettuce cups didn't measure up to this high standard but the soups made up for it.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here.  The seasonal corn soup was very flavorful, and the filet was a perfect medium-rare and melt-in-your-mouth good.  We also enjoyed the pepperoni flatbread and the desserts (S'mores and mocha macchiato shooters).  The bartender and wait staff (Cody) took very good care of us.  We'll definitely be back next time we're in Chicago.

I first went to the restaurant when friends where in town for the Grateful Dead and fell in love. So I had to go back and I took my fiance so we went there last night and had baked chicken and Salmon. The food was spectacular but the service is why I'm on Yelp. Our hostess Gabrielle and our waitress Rachel!! I felt like a celebrity I eat out often by far this was A class service!!! # SEASONS 52
Awesome food n cocktails !! Loved it The service was fast and the starters are amazing, definitely to look out for daily specials
Always have amazing service and food. Never a disappointment! The flights and flatbread is an amazing deal.
Fresh and tasty food. We went for my daughters birthday and service and food were very good.
I loved the vegetarian option, wine was great and good atmosphere. The service was great too!

What a GREAT find! Stopped by after catching a movie and were talked through the menu by our wonderful server ("Xio" was her name.) She explained how the menus changed every so often to make it a very unique experience.  Our dishes were excellent- I would explain what we had, but they might change it, haha! I will say however that the dessert shooters were divine! Well worth trying! Thanks Xio and team for an excellent evening- we'll be back!
Great drink and good selection! Classy atmosphere but casual vibes. Had great conversations here. Loved the duck wings.
Very nice atmosphere, great and customer focused wait staff... The summer menu and wine were excellent.

We loved this restaurant! You must try the flatbread and any cool appetizers the waiter suggests. We mainly ordered seafood and we all loved our plates. Hands down, they served me the best salmon I've ever had. The service was exceptional as well!!!

This review is about 6 months later than my actual experience because it dawned on me that I never wrote a review for this place.  Better late than never! Solid three stars from me.  This restaurant felt very corporate-chain-y and geared toward more mature patrons.  It was something that less adventuresome eaters would enjoy as the menu was pretty generic and the wine pours were plentiful. I'm just not a big fan of the corporate chains I guess. We sampled a bunch of things from the happy hour menu as we were in here after work in a large group a while back. I think this is perfect for that sort of thing.

My Fiance & I LOVE this restaurant. They did such a great job of making it a memorable and romantic evening, it is now our favorite place for dinner date nights. P.s. Try the Scallops, They're Amazing!
I took my daughter there to celebrate Thanksgiving.  We ordered from the regular menu.  The food was as expected for an American-new cuisine.  It was not bad, but also not extraordinary.

Me and my date had a great time at Season 52. We were there on a Sunday night a little earlier so we just waited at the bar. The bartender was very nice and funny, he fixed us up with some tasty drinks. Then we were told that it was going to be another 10 min wait for our table which was ok because it gave us time to close out our tab. Once we were finally seated our waiter was just delightful as well as very helpful. We sample some wines and made our decision for dinner. All in all the service, food, and atmospheres were very enjoyable. I will come back again and recommend others to visit.

Made sure we had reservations for a Saturday night dinner but it was not packed at all. A very quiet scene that was more filled with the older crowd. The flat breads were really good for appetizer and reasonably priced. It threw me off a little because everything that was raved about on yelp wasn't on their menu anymore, since they change their menu weekly depending on what ingredients they have. Their dishes were not cheap but it was mostly seafood or nice meats. My food was alright and my friends who got scallops or pasta liked it, but found that the vegetables on the side were funky or hard to chew. I kind of wish I just ordered another flatbread. They have a bunch of cute dessert shooters to choose from and anyone who's birthday it is gets one for free! We tried almost all of them and thought they were pretty good, just a nice little touch to end your meal on a sweet note. I think part of the reason why I couldn't wrap my head around how this restaurant is supposed to be really nice is just because I hear it's related to Olive Garden but at the end of the day the food was pretty good - there's nothing else on the menu that would really draw me back right now, but if I had to go again for some occasion, I know I could find something edible to eat (although will probably be $20+)

This is fine food for one who wants to be surely gluten free or strictly monitor calories. The use wholesome ingredients, they say.  A tip, they have $5 small plates during happy hour.  Please see attached photos.

Season's 52 has a great happy hour special menu with $5 small plates. I understand that it's a special because it's the slow part of the day where people are in between getting off of work and getting home to grab dinner. My friend and I walked in and were bit to ask about Happy Hour. We were asked to sit by the bar. My Friend is 7 months pregnant she wanted off to the bar area. We didn't know you it was strict about where you sat for happy hour specials. So we had to move to sit at the bar in order to get the specials. I guess, I ordered a lemonade and she had water and we were able to order the $5 plates. We loved the food, it was delicious. We had, CARAMELIZED GRILLED SEA SCALLOPS, DUCK WING "LOLLIPOPS" OAK-GRILLED MEATBALLS, SHRIMP SCAMPI SKILLET, GRILLED CHICKEN YAKITORI SKEWERS and KONA-CRUSTED LOLLIPOP LAMB CHOPS. Everything was good the food is very good deal during the happy hour specials. The service was fine. I wish they weren't so strict about where to sit for happy hour specials as my friend was pregnant and sitting by the bar was weird for us. As we didn't even feel like drinking cocktails. Other that was good. I would only return if I had someone interested in tasting the wines with me.

My sister and I went there to eat dinner when we were on a business trip to Chicago . I heard a lot of good things about this restaurant from my friend and they told me that they change menu every seasons.  I decide to try it and the food is really good . We order the flat bread and it was really good and fresh .  We also order the salmon with veggies and the fish is so fresh . I love the veggie too . Also , we order the chicken salad . The salad is so fresh and I love it that they put goat cheeses in there . :)  I have a really good experience at Season 52.
Outstanding grill! Dishes are well thought, juicy, very fresh and tasty! Try scallops and salmon. Don't forget to ask for desert, you will be impressed by their short-like tiny desserts.

Came here after giving up on our projected 3 hour wait at Purple Pig.  Friday evening, no wait. The place was packed enough. Our server, Nathaniel was thorough, he just needed to check in on us more often.  Full disclosure: I drank a glass of beer and downed a Pinot Noir on an empty stomach, prior to eating... So maybe my palette wasn't 100% accurate at the time... But im pretty sure the food was good, which accounts for the full 3 stars.  I ordered lamb (medium) and he ordered NY strip steak (medium rare). Perfectly cooked and seasoned/garnished.  Dessert was pretty good as well. They have a cute set-up where they bring you all of their desserts in shot glasses and you choose which one you want.  The place needs a bit updating, it looks like a step above Olive Garden... But their service and attentiveness at Olive Garden is actually better. they had a hostess who was taking people to their tables, so right before us she took a couple to their table and took FOREVER to get back to the front and service us. They should have the hostess stay int he front and have the servers take the people to their table. We almost left -- we already waited enough at Purple Pig.  The price is ridiculous for the lack of experience... Chicago Cut is cheap compared to lack of dining experience/small portions here ($30 6oz NY steak).  I don't know about other dishes, but I recommend the entrees we ordered.

We stopped by here for drinks on Saturday night; loved the cozy booths where you can actually have a conversation, and the attentive staff. The cocktail are basically 2 glasses; wished they hadn't closed at 11!

I love the atmosphere here. Dark wood, spacious bar and restaurant area, big booths, the focus is on comfort. They have a huge rectangular bar and extensive wine selection. I also love that they put the calorie information on the entrees so you know ballpark the nutritional information of the food. I ordered the Grilled Garlic Pesto chicken pizza, expecting greatness. Unfortunately, the crust was paper thin and the cheese was minimal, but I guess that is what you get for a 400 calorie pizza. Also, I don't really think the flavors worked well together or maybe the pizza just had too much garlic? But I love garlic, so I don't know. I also ordered the Kale Ceasar which was awesome. Everyone I was with really like their entrees (trout, salmon) but agreed they were still hungry after eating them. So we did the obvious thing, ordered the dessert sampler! with twelve "shots" of different kinds of cake/pudding/whipcream deserts this was a unanimous decision and one we did not regret. I would also remark service was fast and friendly, even when our group got a bit rowdy. I would definitely come back here to give some of their other "low cal" entrees a chance. Lots of fun and we came on Valentines Day as a group of four and had no problems getting a reservation.

My wife and I had dinner here last Friday and had a WONDERFUL time. Our server, management hell even the hostess were VERY nice and enthusiastic. Everything was GREAT from the wine (which our server Maria helped my wife to find) to the appetizers, dinner AND dessert. We definitely feel this is keeper and we will be back! Everyone were very accommodating and we do appreciate that VERY much.

Excellent food, excellent experience!  My wife and I come here all the time.  This place is a little pricey, but good food is not cheap!  I highly recommend the location in downtown Chicago.  You will love it!

The staff at Seasons 52 made our rehearsal dinner a great start to our wedding weekend. Of our 18 guests, we had two guests with very specific dietary restrictions that they were able to accommodate without a problem. The room was set up according to our specifications, including the gifts that had been dropped off earlier in the day. We were allowed to have a cake delivered from an outside bakery with no cutting fees. I was pleasantly surprised by the value we received, very reasonable price for a restaurant in downtown Chicago. The food was delicious as it always is when we visit the restaurant. Thank you Seasons 52 for comforting our exhaustion and wedding jitters! We were well fed, well taken-care of, and in the best position possible to return to our hotels to relax and get a good night's sleep. And we did!
Good service and food. Love every seasons that I've been to, and this one was no different.

This is a 4.5 star review, but you have to go 4 or 5, so I rounded up.  Excellent service tonight, my first visit to this restaurant.  The food was also very good.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.  The desserts are small, but the one I tried was excellent.

I was feeling super queasy when I went here (gilt tripped on to a last minute girls night out) but nothing on the menu appealed to me. My super sensitive stomach could only handle a few things. Luckily the waitress and cook accepted special request of steamed veggies and mashed potatoes, an item that was not on the menu at the time. What's better is they have vitamin water on tap! I'd def go back again. They made a queasy girl feel like mom was taking care of her.

We love this place. It has been excellent all four times we have been there. Each time we have tried something different and never been disappointed. The scallops are wonderful, as is the chicken, and lamb. The fact that everything on the menu is of gourmet quality yet low in calories is amazing. And the dessert, well just go and see for yourself. We live in Chicago part-time in the heart of River North. So, we have the pick of many great restaurants within walking distance. We prefer local Chicago places in general. But we will gladly make an exception, over and over again, for Seasons 52.
Came back for lunch yesterday and they do have a gluten sensitive menu. I had the asparagus soup and lettuce wrap tacos. Service was good, booths were comfortable, and food ingredients were fresh.
Salumi flatbread was quite good. Scallops were quite mediocre.  Bartender told me they a top seller.  I was disappointed.  Just under cooked and overly chewy.
I've had meals at both the Chicago and the Oak Brook locations. Neither site will disappoint you! Excellent service and food!!

The ahi tuna crunch salad is one of the best salads I've had. I can't believe I just said that. Hah. And this place is a chain. The housemade ginger agave drink is amazing-- you can literally taste the fresh ginger it. Service is great. The menu has an impressive selection of items. Why 4 stars? The interior is a little out of place in downtown Chicago. It feels very non-trendy-ish. It's like a restaurant you would find right next to Woodfield mall in Schaumburg though there's nothing wrong with that. Ugh I wished I could put it in better words... it just feels very old fashioned, and I don't mean vintage (I like vintage). The furniture and upholstery of the booth seating feels outdated.

Very torn here. The customer service was awesome. I came here for Valentine's Day dinner and the waiters were overwhelmed but very apologetic. The manager came around with $25 gift certificates for a future visit as a "Thank you for the visit." The drinks (old fashioned especially) were solid. I take that back, the old fashioned was fantastic. But the food...meh. I just felt like it was a little pricey for low-calorie food..my dining partner was hungry two hours later haha
It was ok, i imagine it was going to be better since i had been in one of them in Miami and food was deliciois, but then i was a bit disappointed this time.. Desert was pretty poor.

fresh, local, vegetarian,... checks all the boxes. all except one; with such a concept, i'd expect the place to look a bit more "hip". this place looks like that all-night, standard restaurant found at your hotel. dark and old-fashioned.  it's SO much better than that! the interior definitely needs a facelift to really promote what they offer - healthy food made enticing :)  it's a lot to dole out for lunch but not to sound cliche, " you get what you pay for". you know you are digesting only the best ingredients. my friend and i took 45 minutes to order because yes, we were girls catching up over lunch but also, because we were so overwhelmed by the choices! we finally went with a truffle mushroom salad that was devoured in minutes, the tamale bites (our least favorite but still good), cream of mushroom soup, bright and colorful caprese salad, perfectly roasted brussel sprouts and hearty stuffed mushrooms. cannot wait to go back and try their spring menu!

My husband and I have been here three or four times since it opened last year, most recently for lunch on Thursday, March 12. The menu changes seasonally, so I'm not sure how apropos it would be to mention specific dishes, but we've had seafood and game, desserts, mains and appetizers, and enjoyed most of the dishes....which is high praise indeed! (Scallops, duck, venison, flank steak, trout. Flatbreads, chocolate mousse, key lime trifle.) The short version is that we will be back again. And there are enough good restaurants in this neighborhood that we need not ever return to a restaurant we found mediocre. And we would suggest it to people who aren't inclined to a specific cuisine but rather meals with quality ingredients that aren't gussied up. There's something to be said for a chef that gets out of the way of tasty ingredients. We may be somewhat inclined to like the restaurant because it's across the street from the hotel where we usually stay; we tend to come in January and February, when Chicago's too COLD to walk far. But (and this is an important but), we didn't realize it was part of the same family as Red Lobster and Olive Garden until after the second time we'd eaten here. The only real indication of it being part of the chain lies in the complete nutritional information they provide for their dishes...and this I appreciate, as I need to limit sodium in my diet. Who'd like the restaurant, other than those of us who don't feel like walking far on a given day? It's a moderately quiet (unless the piano player's in the bar area) dark restaurant, not outrageously pricey for this neighborhood. The food's not extravagantly spiced or sauced, but tasty for all that, so suitable for adventurous children.

25 minutes. No service. Adios, people. The manager invited me to sit in the open seating in the bar, I sat down. Nobody came by, nobody walked by and said, "I'll be with you in a minute," nothing. It was about 1/2 full in the bar area, and definitely not an overwhelmed situation by any stretch of the imagination.  #failingthebasics

On my quest to try new things, thanks to you Yelpers, I was able to stumble upon Seasons 52... I really enjoyed the experience I had. I sat at the bar and I ordered the Lobster & Fresh Mozzarella Flatbread ($16) which turned out to be delicious! To top it off I ordered the mini dessert shooter - Key Lime and the waitress let me try the Mocha something shooter, both were savory and satisfying!!! The service was a bit sluggish, typical for Chicago on a Saturday, but the waitress was pleasant and helpful with recommendations. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends.
This places service is impeccable!!!! The food was amazing, drinks were amazing!!! Who knew! Definitely coming back!!

Went during Chicago restaurant week.  Spent about $35 and got a 4-course meal!  All the dishes were under 500 calories which is simply amazing.  We started off with the steak mushroom flatbread.  The mushroom did alter the taste of the dish, so I would recommend the tomato flatbread instead.  Garden salad was delish - we all actually enjoyed eating the salad.  Filet mignon was cooked really well and the chocolate raspberry dessert was divine.  Love the ambiance.  Service could have been a tad better and the lighting is a little too dim for me.  Overall, I'd come here again each season to see what they have to offer.

I've been to Seasons 52 several times and enjoy the healthy cuisine and just-right sized desserts. However, last night was a disappointment. After the waiter went through the several items they were low or out of, I was wondering what was up. Ordered the scallops with broccolini only to receive it with asparagus.  I avoid asparagus at all costs! When I asked, the waiter said they were also out of broccolini, he just hadn't thought it was important enough to mention.  He finally acknowledged they were swamped on Saturday night and ran out of items. I can understand not being able to get fresh fish on Sunday, but vegetables? Go to the store!

I would give the food 4.5 stars, but the service 2. Our waitress was great, very personable and attentive. My issue is with the host, who forgot our reservation and seated us about 30 minutes after the reservation. Even though everything was great overall, this took the experience down a notch.

I'm glad this place exists, but I don't think I need to go back there. I went with a group of people for a business meeting. We shared a few appetizers (hummus and the chicken skewers), neither of which were spectacular. Pretty bland. I had the scallops, which came with a large portion of broccolini and a very small portion of butternut squash risotto. I thought it was good, though a few of the scallops were pretty fishy-tasting. I'd wished there was more risotto so that I would've felt fully satisfied. I think it's a little pricey for what it is. The scallop dish and a glass of wine cost me $35. As my friend said, "If I was going to eat healthy, I'd just eat at home." There's some truth to that. If I'm going out, I want something I wouldn't make at home (where I could have a whole meal for about $5).  I went home and ate a sleeve of Girl Scout Thin Mints.
Got sick from eating here, period. Food seemed fresh and healthy though so must just be a problem in the kitchen.

This place is amazing. I had the filet mignon and my boyfriend had the salmon. We both loved out food. The steak was perfectly seared and juicy on the inside. We started with the braised beef flatbread which was equally delicious. I want to keep going back.
Fantastic dinner. Venison Chop was great. Pear cocktail that my wife had was delicious, according to her...I would lose my "Man Card" if I ordered so I didn't ;-) Solid place!
Absolutely love it! Great Ambiance Great food! Will definitely be back! I like to consider myself to eat healthy and everything on menu was healthy!

The best scallops I've ever had. The service was impeccable and my date and I enjoyed ourselves too much. The perfect serving sizes to fully enjoy yet not be over stuffed. Desert was great! I will definitely be a repeat customer!

What a fabulous restaurant in a convenient location across the street from the Conrad.  We had a large party of twenty.  Food was delicious - I enjoyed the scallops.  Service very attentive and appropriate.

One of the best restaurants I been to. Everything is great here seriously; I don't think I have try something I didn't like. The best part for me are the desserts perfect way to end the night. Keep up the good work I ll be coming back soon!!!

Went there for Chicago restaurant week. Must I say I was glad to be there! Food and ambiance are great, ordered the flatbreads. Steak and goats cheese flatbread, was just okay- was not a fan, tomato flatbread was actually pretty yummy. Salads were great too and had filet mignon and grilled salmon which were both really flavorful! Desserts were the best part! Absolutely divine little shots of goodness!! Def will go back!
Had lunch here on a Saturaday. Was a lovely respite from the hectic pace and longer waits other places. Service was terrific and the food was wonderful . Highly recommend .

It was my first time eatingg here and I must say I enjoyed the whole experience.  The staff was very attentive and pleasant.  Our waiter Patrick was the best.  The cost was fair considering the quality of food you were getting.  I liked my entire meal. Its a great place for dates or lunch with friends. I will definitely be returning.

I love this place! It is one of my favorite places to eat downtown. Everyone I have brought here loves it too. The fact that everything here is lower calorie is awesome and especially that you don't feel like you are eating light. Their brussel sprouts are absolutely delicious. I would eat them everyday if I could. Their artichoke goat cheese flatbread is wonderful too. Very crispy and tasty. The caprese was good-nothing out of the ordinary. Their desserts were good too. Nothing crazy. Service is always very attentive. Their decor is very sleek, and a great place to take a date.

I would rate it a 5 but they they fired all the musicians because they were competing with themselves (EddieV's across the street which they own). EddieV's has jazz, Seasons52 had a solo pianist - much different. So I have news for management - keeping music at EddieV's doesn't and eliminating music at Seasons52 doesn't make me want to shift to EddieV's - in fact it just wants me to stop coming to either. Artists need a workplace too!
I was once a fan, but the things have gone down. I'm unsure if the business is slow or if they're trying to cut down on costs, but they have lost my business.

Seasons 52 is your typical chain restaurant with tasteless flatbreads and bland pasta. It's not particularly cheap either. There are many other better restaurants in Chicago for the price that you'll pay at this restaurant.

Unbelievable experience!  I went here for my birthday with my husband and the entire staff did an exceptional job making it a special evening. From the birthday card that awaited me at the front, to the complimentary champagne and dessert, it far exceeded my expectations. I ordered the filet and scallops which were both great. I also recommend the stuffed mushrooms for an app!

Have dined here multiple times and everytime has been great. Wish they had the piano player behind the bar still but the atmosphere is still nice. Wine list is expansive and the flights are a great way to sample a few kinds. I enjoy how the menu changes frequently and that will keep me coming back in the future

Food is great. Very nice service! And they are very accommodating in case you have a taste for something particular etc. I keep going back for lunch probably once a month and it's always simply a good experience and you won't get disappointed with anything. Nice and cozy atmosphere.

Seasons 52 seriously impressed me!  I wasn't sure what to except with Darden group but I was very happy with my experience.  The restaurant is very nice inside and has a nice wine room. The menu was extensive!  The server was very helpful and walked us through the menu options.  It was very hard to decide what to order because it all sounded so good! We started with Tamale Tots which were very interesting and a Tuna sushi roll which was dynamite!  I could have ordered more :) For entrees, I ordered the Chef's suggestion short rib flat bread.  This was extra crispy, cheesy, meaty and delicious!  My fiance had the fish tacos which looked pretty good.  He ate them all quickly so I suspect he agreed. I would def come back for a visit!

In all honesty I did not have high expectations for this place when I realized it was connected to the same ownership as Red Lobster and Olive Garden but I was pleasantly surprised. The menu had tons of options sure to meet almost anyone's taste. I also thought it was really cool that every option has 475 calories or less. It's so hard to go out to eat nowadays and try to eat healthy. For My main dish I got the Blackened Mahi Mahi tacos with pico de gallo, salsa verde and cilantro sour cream. These were quite tasty but the best part of the meal was the appetizer. We got the Tuna & Avocado Sushi Roll wrapped in soy mame nori. Next time I come back I think I'll skip the meal all together and get 3 of these, because they were so fresh and so amazing! Great location + good atmosphere + awesome Tuna & Avocado Sushi Roll = Me Coming Back again!

My husband and I made New Years Eve reservations at this restaurant to use some gift cards we had gotten for Christmas. What a great experience! It was both our first times there and I love the menu concept. Everything we ordered was fabulously delicious. We had the rack of lamb and the filet mignon (which melted in my mouth) and the chicken skewer appetizer. There were so many dessert shot options we got 4! Well, we picked 3 to share and our server, Jeff, threw one in for free! Oh, and he's the reason I'm writing this review! Jeff was so great! Friendly and funny and knew the menu really well. He recommended a mid pp red wine for my husband which he loved.  We will definitely be back here for more meals!

Sat at the bar with my friend and we both got the flights and flatbread special.  Nice ambiance.  Friendly bartenders.  The wines were nice.  The flatbreads (we got lobster and the spicy chorizo) were good, but I didn't find them as amazing as many other yelpers described.  Overall it was a fun time though.

Went last night for NYE. Made 745p reservation but arrived 10 mins early. They wouldn't seat us until closer to our res time which was interesting since they sat us at a booth at the bar! Disappointed at first but then got over it because food and drinks were great. I had the pork w/ mashed sweet potatoes and boyfriend had shrimp pasta, equally good. Also had crab, shrimp stuffed mushroom app. Great! Perfect storm cocktail was awesome! Tiny desserts are so fun and delicious!

I've eaten at Seasons 52 several times, both for group events and for meals with family and/or friends and have had a great experience each time. The food is delicious - I particularly enjoyed the bbq chicken salad and various flatbreads for my entree as well as the perfectly portioned desserts. The last time I went, we ordered from the "Flights and Flatbread" menu, which included a flight of three wines, plus a glass of the favorite of the three, as well as a flatbread, for a great price. The service has also been very good each time. Chris has been our server several times when I've gone and is very knowledgeable, friendly and provides excellent customer service.  I highly recommend Seasons 52 with it's unique concept of serving lighter but tasty and well portioned meals and it's focus on seasonal ingredients.

My family and I attended this restaurant for the first time for my mothers birthday and we all enjoyed it! Our waitress Chelsea was so accommodating and knowledgeable of the menu.  When it came down to the drinks we told her exactly what we liked and she brought us just what we needed.  The place had just the right music and lighting for everyone to have a comfortable time. I would definitely recommend eating here. The menu changes according to what's in season so you know your food is the freshest of the fresh!
The food is good but the service was bad, they got 2/5 orders wrong and the replacements arrived after all the rest of the party was done.

What a terrific restaurant!!  We love the food, the drinks, ambience, the decor and on top of the above was the service from our waiter, Sean.  We had a wonderful time last night.  Just absolute delightful!!  We will definitely will go back for more!!

Sean was our waiter. He was very knowledgeable and engaging. I am always impressed when a waiter can take our order without writing it down and get the order correct. I know I would have a hard time doing that. The food was excellent. I have been before a few times to the Schaumburg location and this was my first visit to your downtown location. My other 3 dining partners never ate at Seasons 52 before - I am so pleased that all were very satisfied with the quality of the food. Drinks and dessert were equally delightful.
I have had 1000+ filets in my life.  This one tonight was the most tender steak I have ever eaten.  Also, very well seasoned.  The sides were awesome. And the service was impeccable
The lobster flatbread was amazing, and absolutely LOVE the Cranberry sage cocktail!  Filet mignon was fine, I should have ordered just medium rare...

Another fine meal at seasons with over the top service.  Thanks Carlo.  I am sorry the restaurant gave up the live piano music.  Probably for good reason, but the music added class to the great food and service
Loved the food! They are not known for their steak but the filet was AMAZING. highly recommend it.

5 stars for ambience and wine/drink list. Food was ok.. Beet salad ..nice, ahi tuna salad... Boring.. The tuna good but lettuce and toppings were.. Mei  Friends had scallops .. Seemed happy with choice Server was attentive to the point of annoying. He repeatedly interrupted our business conversation. His dessert presentation was significantly longer than the entree menu. What's up with that?
The food was amazing, the service even better. Chris S. was our server and was fantastic. Highly recommend this establishment

Absolutely loved this place!! My boyfriend and I celebrated our 2 year anniversary here and I'm so glad we did.  The place is romantic and the live music was really nice! We started with a bottle of of the Markham, Napa Chardonnay. The server was sweet enough to give us a tasting of few other wines too.  The roasted roma tomato flat bread was the best flat bread I have had till date!!  For our main course, my boyfriend had the Oak-grilled Filet Mignon and I had the Wood-Grilled Pork Tenderloin. Both were cooked to perfection and tasted heavenly!!  Since it was our anniversary, the dessert was on the house! They had us choose from about 9 of their signature Mini Indulgence options. We got the Belgian Chocolate S'more which was a perfect ending to our dining experience!

I've never been to this restaurant before, but it was the only restaurant I could find that was open on Thanksgiving day and also had dinner for under $30pp. At 6pm I made a reservation with the Open Table app for 7:30. We arrived at 7:20 and were seated right away. Our waiter came over and told us about the menu and the wines and then informed us that they had run out of stuffing for the Thanksgiving dinner and were currently making a new batch. We decided to wait and ordered a glass of wine. After about 45 minutes our food arrived. Everything looked really good and everything tasted great. My only grievance was that we waited all this extra time for the stuffing and when it came out, the amount of stuffing on my plate was smaller than the palm of my hand (see picture).  After the main course, they brought out the mini indulgences tray and they told us we could pick whichever one we wanted even though the menu said the pumpkin pie one was what was included in the meal. I opted for the Key Lime Pie and the boyfriend got the pecan pie. The pecan pie was really good but my key lime pie was both too tart and too sweet. I couldn't finish it. Overall we really enjoyed our meal and the restaurant was probably the best chain restaurant I've ever eaten at.

We went here for restaurant week, and had so much food! I love the flatbred and the soup. The chicken skewer appetizer was entree size. The lemon shrimp soup was delicious. The filet mignon was an absolute dream! Service was a little slow though. The space was dark spacious and charming.

What  a wonderful place to celebrate a special anniversary!  Manager Ozzie was most welcoming and offered our group of seven a champagne toast before we even ordered our meal.  We shared a few appetizers and enjoyed them all.  More hummus than flatbread, so our waiter gladly replenished for us!    Kitchen was a bit slow at getting out dinners and some came late but overall a good and delicious experience.  Portions are just the right size.  Dessert shooters - a must!  Very creative menu, food looks and tastes great.  Great music from the piano bar, nice dining experience - can't wait to come back and try more menu items and desserts!

I had dinner here with my family in honor of my parents' milestone anniversary. We ordered several of the appetizers, which were all brought out quickly and enjoyed. Everyone ordered something different, and everyone was happy with their choice -- each meal was a nice portion with a nice plate presentation. Seasons 52 really shined in the service area. When prompted about the occasion, our server Eric and the maitre d' Ozzie were quick to bring out a round of champagne for the table, a card for my parents, and a set of wine glasses to take home. Eric did a great job describing the menu and guiding us through choices. After dinner, they brought out an awesome array of mini-desserts for us. For a national restaurant in a town with a lot of locally-run competition, we were blown away with the personal attention and care we got. I'll withhold one star because the dish I originally ordered was out on a relatively quiet Sunday night, and I didn't learn about it until 15 minutes after placing the order. That said, I was very impressed with my second-choice dish.

The drinks, food, and music were great. Prices were decent and the volume was moderate. The lifting was dim. I would definitely say this is a good place for couples, girls night out, and a great neighborhood gem. I would probably return.
Great attentive service. Venison chop was excellent. Seated well for an early dinner without reservations. Perfect sized desserts.  Will be back.

I have a love/hate relationship with Seasons 52. For me, I now realize that it comes down to their seasonal menu. If I like the menu, I like the place. Seems obvious, I know ... but was somewhat of an "a-ha" for me. Liked the menu this particular time, so you're in luck, Seasons 52! This was my first time visiting the Chicago location and I ordered take-out. Phone ordering was easy, food was ready when I got there and still hot when I got back to my hotel. It was tasty and what we had expected. We also ordered two of their signature "shot glass" desserts and were impressed to see that they actually gave us the shot glasses (don't worry, we'll definitely be putting those to good use). Location is right off of Michigan Avenue and a short walk from many of the hotels in the area.

We received a gift card to Seasons 52 and enjoyed a quiet date night. Reservations were easy to make though Opentable and the service at the restaurant was great. We ordered the tuna tartar as a starter and could have licked the plate when we were finished. Next up were two wonderful entrees - my husband had the filet mignon and a lobster tail and I had quail stuffed with risotto. The lobster came out quite a bit after the steak and our server comped it for us without us even mentioned anything about it. In the spirit of date night, we ordered cappuccinos and dessert to finish the meal. Everything was wonderful, but the chances of us coming back without another gift card is low because it is a hike for us to get there.
I've been here 3 times now, and love it every single time. Everything is fresh and so full of flavor- even with everything being under 500 calories. The dessert shots are AMAZING.

In the city and looking for something new we stumbled upon this yelp recommendation. We were drawn to the idea of fresh local food served in unique combinations and we were not disappointed.  My wife ordered a flatbread which contained roasted onions and mushrooms as well as baby spinach and goat cheese and was happy with the selection. The bread was thin and crispy, and the onions very sweet and flavorful. I ordered the quail stuffed with wild mushroom risotto and a side of Brussels sprouts, and I enjoyed every bit of them both, even the wilted spinach served with the bird. We couldn't get out of there without trying some of their mini desserts and selected three. Ginger snap pumpkin, chocolate peanut butter, and S'mores were put to the test. My favorite was the spiced pumpkin and my wife preferred the s'mores... but the peanut butter was also good. Dark and comfortable booths contributed to the ambiance highlighted by a mysterious piano player playing mash ups of popular tunes with a voice like Lionel Ritchie.. Overall enjoyable experience with prices slightly above expectations, but reasonable for Chicago. I nearly forgotten to mention the expansive wine list, though we did not partake..  It makes the list, and if it makes it in this city we will surely return.

My last dinner in Chicago, my friend and I happen to stop by Seasons 52 by mistake and figured why not. We walked in and was greeted by two welcoming hostesses and made a reservation for 8pm. We had some good wine and started out with a delicious three mushroom flatbread as appetizer. Then a couple of two different green salads that we both thought it was too much but too scrumptious to not finish. My friend had the trout with seasoned steamed baby potatoes and some other side dish. I had the swordfish dish and we both enjoyed our entree very much. The only regret I have is not having room for dessert. I should have just gone for it. The whole meal was astonishing. Our server Patrick was the best, nice, respectful, and very informative about the food (ingredients) and even the establishment. They have a live singer who plays the piano as well. Her voice was quite good matter of fact for all sorts of songs she sang that night. Overall it was the best dinner for a last night of my visit in Chicago. Thank you very much!
This place is amazing! The service is always great and everything I've tried so far has been delicious! Make sure you try all there dessert shots, they are to die for!

Very please with my meal last night at Seasons 52.  First of all, the live music was nice.  Second, our server was great and took a lot of time to go over the menu with us.  When we were trying to pick out a wine, he directed us to a very "drinkable" one and we decided to go with it.  Then he mentioned it was a very classic wine - one you could get at the gas station.  Ha, not quite what you want to hear when the restaurant is charging you way more for it, but oh well.  My scallops were great and my friend's salad with seared tuna was really good too.  It is impossible to say no to dessert at the end of the meal when they bring over 10 pre-made desserts to your table and let you pick whatever you want right off the tray.  I will for sure go back and hopefully hit up the happy hour!
This is relatively new in Chicago.  For a chain it is very good and offers a great menu!  Service was above average and the prices where comparatively low for the area!  I would dine there again!!

Where should I start, this place lived up to all the buzz I've heard over time. I purchased a gilt city special which included a four course meal for two plus a specialty cocktail for each of us. We started with this squash soup, followed by chicken flatbread. Next I chose the braised beef tacos and my lunch date had chose a separate entree. He also had a pomegranate martini while I had a paradise martini. Then I had a chocolate martini with my dessert.  Now I purposely menu listed what we enjoyed instead of writing about how each item tasted. The reason I did so is because EVERYTHING was phenomenally fresh, well mixed, cooked perfectly. Our waiter showed us total attentiveness and gave his honest opinion on what was popular, etc. I would surely pay the regular menu prices next time because this place is worth it. I enjoy trying new places and even more when I've found a gem.

This place is a surprise.  We were impressed by the food and drink.  I'm removing at star b/c the ambiance is like you're in the burbs, and for a few minor service issues.  We came where with a Gilt City deal that was for way too much food!  But we can say that we tried a lot of their menu.  We started with a mushroom flat bread which was earthy and crunchy but needed a little seasoning.  We also had some soups.  I had the squash which was maybe a little too tangy for me.  My boyfriend had the chili option which he liked.  Then salads.  Mine was a little boring.  The baby spinach with pear.  It had a little too much mustard flavored dressing and not enough cheese.  My boyfriend got the warm mushroom which was good.  For mains I had the scallops which were nicely cooked.  Not over done.  My boyfriend got the filet which was great.  Then we had the dessert shot glass which at first seems too small but they were just enough.  They were very good too.  To drink I had a seasonal bourbon cocktail.  It was great.  The wine list is very good too.  What a surprise for what used to be a Cosi!  The hostess did her job.  We tried to joke with her about it being a Cosi and we got a blank stare.  Also our waiter was great until we paid the check.  He set down a full drink for me and then we never saw him again.  I hate that after you pay the check and sit to enjoy your drink that you're not checked in on.  Some more water would have been great.  And perhaps we would have ordered more had he asked.  That is a peeve of mine. That being said I would come back here.

Yum! I loved Seasons 52. I especially like that you can feel good about anything you order on the menu - it's all fresh and relatively healthy. Better yet, they offer the most delicious dessert shooters. I had a chocolate mousse dessert and it was phenomenal.

Had an excellent time dining there Saturday night.  The food was top notch and the service was better.  Our server, Joe, was very helpful in picking our entrees and wine.  The room has a great warm feeling to it.  Can't wait to go back!!

Always a huge fan of any Seasons 52! They train their staff impeccably! No matter what city I'm in, the entire staff is always so welcoming, it really is just an amazing experience as far as the customer service alone! My team and I had a late night and Seasons 52 was by our hotel. The 3 other girls I was with had never been to one before, I told them they would love it! The atmosphere is low key and perfect if you need to unwind after a long day, have a date night, or a girl's night out! The wine selection is exquisite, no matter what you type of wine you like, they will have something you love here! And be sure to check out the wine descriptions at this location, the manager was also a sommelier at some point in her career and her descriptions are extremely entertaining!  The food was amazing (as always)! Our waiter was wonderful, we found out at the end of our meal that it was only his 2nd week working there, none of us ever would have guessed it with how knowledgable he was with both the drink and food menu as well as his service. The menu changes often (hence the name), the food is always fresh and on the low calorie side but full of flavor!!! And then, last but certainly not least is the dessert. I get hungry just thinking about it! They bring a variety of desserts to choose from that come in little glass "shooters" and they are to die for! Do not skip dessert! You can also get a few different ones to share if you are in a group which is nice. My fav...the pecan pie...sooooo good!!!! The girls I brought loved it, any time you see a Seasons 52 in your area make sure you check it out, you won't be disappointed!

I attend several trade shows each year in Chicago, and am often confused with a person that knows the better places to eat and entertain customers!  Well, I have eaten at well over 50 establishments, and Seasons 52 has now moved in amongst the top five! Every entree received high praise, and the wine selection easily handled our divergent tastes!  Atmosphere was very conducive to conversation, and Carlos provided the best service I've received in months, and I travel and dine in all 48 contiguous states! Well done Carlos, the chef, hostesses, and others involved!  We WILL be back - probably this week!

Great spur of the moment choice!  Trying to avoid all the large name chain type steak places, we stopped in here and were extremely impressed.  Great atmosphere and quiet despite being busy.  Friendly and attentive wait staff that work together. The goat cheese torta was a good start followed by us sharing a wonderful spinach with carmalized pear salad.  My wife loved the scallops and I was loving the trout.  All great taste combinations.  We loved everything in spite of the fact they were all,low calorie and healthy !!!!

I visited this place last night and our server Maria went out of her way to make our night special. We had mentioned that we were on our first date and she was kind enough to send a complimentary appetizer to our table. She was extremely friendly and also allowed us to try a couple of different wines before making a decision.  The food was great and we will definitely return.

We had a wonderful experience!! Carlo took great care of us at the bar and made our experience very memorable and was very informative about chicago. Ozzie in management was very warm and friendly. Great guest service!

I love this place!  They only serve foods that are in season.  Everything is prepared fresh with fresh ingredients and cooked in a healthy manner.  I believe all dishes were under 475 calories and even the desserts were somewhere around the 300 mark.  The food is delicious and the service is top notch!  They have this cucumber, vodka and basil drink that I LOVE!!!  I came here once with my girls and once with my Mom and sister. I definitely recommend this place!

My girlfriends and I had the most perfect girls night out last night at Seasons 52. It started out with service. Our server Kelly made great suggestions for wine and offered several samples so we could pick out the perfect wine. We has decided to share several appetizers and entrees and the staff could not have been anymore accommodating. The lobster flat bread was to die for and we are still talking about the caramelized scallops today.  The manager, I believe named Ozzy, came around and asked if we were celebrating anything in particular, which we were and was so kind as to get us several of the mini deserts.
